summary: DOE’s Legacy Management Office oversees long-term surveillance and maintenance of cleaned-up U.S. nuclear weapons production and energy research sites. It manages activities like treating residual groundwater contamination and repairing aging landfills. Currently, the Office oversees 100 sites and may manage some for centuries. Site numbers and costs are expected to grow. The Office has not planned how it will handle new cleanup work that is...
title: Environmental Liabilities: DOE Needs to Better Plan for Post-Cleanup Challenges Facing Sites
